sen.j: 大台ヶ原山（おおだいがはらやま）は奈良県吉野郡上北山村、同郡川上村 (奈良県)および三重県多気郡大台町旧宮川村 (三重県)に跨って座す山。
sen.e: Mt. Odaigahara (Odaigaharayama) is located along Kamikitayama Town and Kawakami Town, in Yoshino-gun Nara Prefecture and along the former Miyagawa Village, Odai Town, Taki-gun, Mie prefecture.
Mt. Odaigahara (Odaigaharayama) is located across Kamikitayama Village and Kawakami Village in Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture, and former Miyagawa Village, Odai Town, Taki-gun, Mie prefecture.
Mt. Odaigahara (Odaigaharayama) is located across Kamikitayama Village and Kawakami Village in Yoshino-gun, Nara Prefecture, and former Miyagawa Village, Odai Town, Taki-gun, Mie prefecture.

sen.j: 標高1694.9m（日出ヶ岳）。
sen.e: It is 1694.9 meters high.
It is 1694.9 meters high (Hidegatake).
It is 1694.9 meters high (Hidegatake).

sen.j: 深田久弥によって「日本百名山」の一つとされている。
sen.e: It is designated as one of `one hundred top mountains of Japan' by Kyuya FUKADA.
It is designated as one of `one hundred top mountains of Japan' by Kyuya FUKADA.
It is designated as one of `one hundred top mountains of Japan' by Kyuya FUKADA.

sen.j: 日本百景、日本の秘境100選にも選ばれている。
sen.e: It is also selected as the 100 best sceneries in Japan, and as the 1000 mysterious land of Japan.
It is also included in the 100 best sceneries in Japan, and in the 100 mysterious lands of Japan.
sen.cmt: 1000 mysterious land --> 100 mysterious lands,その他表現の見直し
sen.e: It is also included in the 100 best sceneries in Japan, and in the 100 mysterious lands of Japan.

sen.j: 三重県の最高峰。
sen.e: It is the highest peak in Mie Prefecture.
It is the highest peak in Mie Prefecture.
It is the highest peak in Mie Prefecture.

sen.j: 頂上の平坦な山が周辺にいくつか集中しており、それらをひとまとめにして単に大台ヶ原（おおだいがはら）と言うこともある。
sen.e: Mountains with flat tops are concentrated in the vicinity of Mt. Odaigahara, and those mountains and Mt. Odaigahara are collectively called Odaigahara at times.
Mountains with flat tops are concentrated in the vicinity of Mt. Odaigahara, and those mountains and Mt. Odaigahara are collectively called Odaigahara at times.
Mountains with flat tops are concentrated in the vicinity of Mt. Odaigahara, and those mountains and Mt. Odaigahara are collectively called Odaigahara at times.

sen.j: このような頂上が平坦で周囲を傾斜が急な崖で囲まれている地形を地形輪廻準平原という。
sen.e: Terrains with flat tops surrounded by steep cliffs are called peneplane in cycle of erosion.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。地形輪廻準平原→定訳不明ですが→peneplane in cycle of erosionと訳出しています。
sen.e: Terrains with flat tops surrounded by steep cliffs are called a peneplane in cycle of erosion.
Terrains with flat tops surrounded by steep cliffs are called a peneplane in cycle of erosion.

sen.j: 大台ヶ原は日本では珍しい隆起準平原の例である。
sen.e: Odaigahara is an example of uplifted peneplain, which is rare in Japan,
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Odaigahara is an example of uplifted peneplain, which is rare in Japan,
Odaigahara is an example of uplifted peneplain, which is rare in Japan,

sen.j: また大台ヶ原は世界的に見ても多雨地帯として知られている。
sen.e: In addition, Odaigahara is known as a rainy region from the standpoint of global standpoint.
In addition, Odaigahara is known as a rainy region from a global standpoint.
sen.cmt: from the standpoint of global standpoint --> from a global standpoint
sen.e: In addition, Odaigahara is known as a rainy region from a global standpoint.

sen.j: そのことが植物や動物など生物の生育と分布に大きな影響を与えている。
sen.e: This heavily affects the growth and distribution in living things such as plants or animals.
This heavily affects the growth and distribution of living things such as plants and animals.
sen.cmt: in living things such as plants or animals --> of living things such as plants and animals
sen.e: This heavily affects the growth and distribution of living things such as plants and animals.

sen.j: そのため吉野熊野国立公園のなかでも特に規制の厳しい特別保護地区に指定されている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is designated as a special protection area, which is an especially restricted area, within Yoshino-Kumano National Park.
Therefore, it is designated as a special protection area, which is strictly controlled, within Yoshino-Kumano National Park.
sen.cmt: which is an especially restricted area --> which is strictly controlled
sen.e: Therefore, it is designated as a special protection area, which is strictly controlled, within Yoshino-Kumano National Park.

sen.j: 日出ヶ岳の直下、正木嶺や正木ヶ原のトウヒの立ち枯れと笹原が有名である。
sen.e: The dieback of spruce in Masakimine peak just under Mt. Hinodegatake or in Masakigahara are well-known.
Just below Mt. Hidegatake, the dieback of spruce and bamboo fields in Masakimine peak and Masakigahara are well-known.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れあり。笹原の訳 (bamboo fields)を追加。その他表現の見直し。
sen.e: Just below Mt. Hidegatake, the dieback of spruce and bamboo fields in Masakimine peak and Masakigahara are well-known.

sen.j: これは、1959年に近畿地方を襲った伊勢湾台風がそれまで覆っていた森林を破壊し、その木々が流出したことによりそれまで地面に自生していたコケ類が衰退、代わって、ササ類が繁茂し始めたためである。
sen.e: Behind these, forests were destroyed by Isewan Typhoon which hit Kinki region in 1959, and bamboo started to grow thickly instead of moss which had been growing naturally on the ground and was gone back after trees were outflow.

Behind these, forests were destroyed and trees were washed away by Isewan Typhoon which hit the Kinki region in 1959, and bamboo started to grow thickly instead of moss which had been growing naturally on the ground.

Behind these, forests were destroyed and trees were washed away by Isewan Typhoon which hit the Kinki region in 1959, and bamboo started to grow thickly instead of moss which had been growing naturally on the ground.

sen.j: その笹を主食とするニホンジカの数が増え、針葉樹の実生や樹皮までも採食するといった複合的な要因によって現在の環境に至っている。
sen.e: Current circumstances were caused by combined factors that the seeding or barks of conifers are eaten by Japanese sika deer that mainly eat sasa.

Current circumstances have been established by combined factors such that the number of Japanese shika deer has increased and seedlings and barks of conifers are eaten by the Japanese sika deer that mainly eat bamboo.
As a result, the number of the Japanese deer that mainly eat bamboo has increased and they even eat seedlings and barks of conifers; these complex factors affect the present environmental conditions.

sen.j: シカの影響に関しては、駆除すべきという意見もある。
sen.e: Some people say that Japanese sika deer should be exterminated.
Some people say that the Japanese sika deer should be exterminated to protect the environment from the deer.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れあり。「シカの影響に関しては」の部分の訳を追加。
sen.e: Some people say that the Japanese deer should be exterminated to protect the environment from the deer.

sen.j: また、オオルリやコマドリ、コノハズク等の野生生物の生息地として重要である。
sen.e: Mt. Odaigahara is important as a habitat of wild life such as blue-and-white flycatcher, Japanese robin, and Japanese scops owl.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Mt. Odaigahara is important as a habitat for wildlife such as a blue-and-white flycatcher, Japanese robin, and Japanese scops owl.
sen.cmt: a habitat of wild life such as blue-and-white flycatcher --> a habitat for wildlife such as a blue-and-white flycatcher
sen.e: Mt. Odaigahara is important as a habitat for wildlife such as a blue-and-white flycatcher, Japanese robin, and Japanese scops owl.

sen.j: このため、国指定大台山系鳥獣保護区（大規模生息地）に指定されている（面積18,054ヘクタール、うち特別保護地区1,403ha）。
sen.e: For this reason, it is designated as government-designated Mt. Odaigahara wildlife refuge (1,403 hectares of special protection area within the area of 18,054 hectares).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: For this reason, it is designated as government-designated Mt. Odaigahara wildlife refuge (large-scale habitat) (1,403 hectares of special protection area within the total area of 18,054 hectares).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れあり。（大規模生息地）の訳(large-scale habitat)を追記、その他表現の見直し
sen.e: For this reason, it is designated as government-designated Mt. Odaigahara wildlife refuge (large-scale habitat) (1,403 hectares of special protection area within the total area of 18,054 hectares).

sen.j: 大台ケ原を散策するにはビジターセンターからとなるが、大台ケ原を堪能するなら「東大台ハイキングコース」約9キロがお勧め。
sen.e: For enjoy hiking Mt. Odaigahara, `Higashi Odai hiking course,' approximately 9 kilometers is recommended starting at the visitor center.
For enjoy hiking in Mt. Odaigahara, `Higashi Odai hiking course,' approximately 9 kilometers is recommended starting at the visitor center.
sen.cmt: For enjoy hiking Mt. Odaigahara --> For enjoy hiking in Mt. Odaigahara
sen.e: For enjoy hiking in Mt. Odaigahara, `Higashi Odai hiking course,' approximately 9 kilometers is recommended starting at the visitor center.

sen.j: 標準的に4時間あれば十分まわれる距離となる。
sen.e: As a standard, four hours are sufficient to go around.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In general, four hours are sufficient to go around.
In general, four hours are sufficient to go around.

sen.j: だが途中荒れた道や、線形 (路線)勾配のきつい道が点在するので普段運動をしない人にとって多少厳しい。
sen.e: However, there are bumpy roads or roads with high inclination dotting the mountain, which is tough for the people who don't usually do any exercises.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, as there are bumpy roads or roads with high inclination dotting the mountain, the hiking can be tough for people who do not usually do any exercises.
However, as there are bumpy roads or roads with high inclination dotting the mountain, the hiking can be tough for people who do not usually do any exercises.

sen.j: ビジターセンターで販売しているハイキングマップ（100円）には3コース紹介されている。
sen.e: Three courses are shown on the hiking map sold at the visitor center (100 yen).
Three courses are shown on the hiking map sold at the visitor center (100 yen).
Three courses are shown on the hiking map sold at the visitor center (100 yen).

sen.j: その中にはこれよりも半分程度の距離のハイキングコースも紹介されている。
sen.e: Another hiking course with a half distance of the regular course is shown too.
Another hiking course with a half distance of the regular course is shown too.
Another hiking course with a half distance of the regular course is shown too.

tit.e: Restriction on the entry to the mountain
Restriction on the entry to the mountain
Restriction on the entry to the mountain

sen.j: 上記のことから、環境省はより西大台地区において入山規制を実施することを決定した。
sen.e: From those stated above, the Ministry of the Environment decided to restrict the entry to the mountain in Nishiodai district.
From those stated above, the Ministry of the Environment decided to restrict the entry to the mountain in Nishiodai district.
From those stated above, the Ministry of the Environment decided to restrict the entry to the mountain in Nishiodai district.

sen.j: 規制以降入山するには、予め申し込んで有料の認定証を取得し、入山当日は大台ヶ原ビジターセンターで講義を受ける必要がある。
sen.e: After implementation of the restriction, climbers are required to apply for the paid entry to the mountain in advance to obtain a permit, and to take a lecture at the Odaigahara visitor center on the day of entry to the mountain.

After implementation of the restriction, climbers are required to apply for the paid entry to the mountain in advance to obtain a permit, and to take a lecture at the Odaigahara visitor center on the day of entry to the mountain.

After implementation of the restriction, climbers are required to apply for the paid entry to the mountain in advance to obtain a permit, and to take a lecture at the Odaigahara visitor center on the day of entry to the mountain.

sen.j: なお、東大台地区は入山規制の対象外となっている。
sen.e: Higashiodai district is exempt from the restriction.
Higashiodai district is exempt from the restriction.
Higashiodai district is exempt from the restriction.

tit.e: The number of climbers in a day
The number of climbers in a day
The number of climbers in a day

sen.j: （）内はゴールデンウィーク、お盆、紅葉シーズンにおける人数。
sen.e: The numbers shown in parentheses are the numbers during the Golden Week Holidays, the Bon Festival period, and during foliage season.
The numbers shown in parentheses are the numbers during the Golden Week Holidays, the Bon Festival period, and the foliage season.
sen.cmt: and during foliage season --> and the foliage season
sen.e: The numbers shown in parentheses are the numbers during the Golden Week Holidays, the Bon Festival period, and the foliage season.
Weekday 30 (50)
Weekday 30 (50)
Weekday 30 (50)
Saturday, Sunday, and Holidays 50 (100)
Saturday, Sunday, and National holiday 50 (100)
Saturday, Sunday, and National holiday 50 (100)

sen.j: オオダイガハラサンショウウオ
sen.e: Ohdaigahara Salamander
Ohdaigahara Salamander
Ohdaigahara Salamander

dendrocopos major
dendrocopos major

sen.e: Japanese sika deer

Red spotted masu trout

sen.j: 奈良県道40号大台ケ原公園川上線（大台ヶ原ドライブウェイ）
sen.e: Nara Prefectural Route 40, Odaigahara-Park Kawakami Route (Odaigahara Driveway)
